Personne à contacter en premier lieu
Personne à contacter en deuxième lieu

en_string: The primary purpose of this booklet is to help you prepare for a visit with a health professional, most specifically in emergency situations. It is conceived to assist you in communicating in English and convey your health concerns with non-bilingual health professionals. However, it was impossible to cover all health topics. We focused on health issues that are the most frequent reasons to visit an emergency room or a walk-in clinic. We hope you find it useful.

This booklet is meant as a guide to facilitate communication between English-speakers and French speaking health professionals. It does not in any way, shape or form replace a professional medical opinion.

This simple 3-digit number is all you need to reach Info-Santé services from anywhere in Quebec. It allows you to speak in English with a health professional for non-urgent situations and it may save you an unnecessary trip to the emergency room.

location: How to prepare for a visit to the doctor
en_string: 1- Write down your health concerns in order of priority (concise, priorize one)

location: How to prepare for a visit to the doctor
en_string: 2- Current list of medications (taking or have taken since last visit)

location: How to prepare for a visit to the doctor
en_string: 3- Make a list of over-the-counter and herbal remedies tried since last visit

location: How to prepare for a visit to the doctor
en_string: 4- Change of lifestyle (diet, exercise, travel out of the country)

location: How to prepare for a visit to the doctor
en_string: 5- List of symptoms (what makes them better or worst)
Such as high blood pressure, diabetes, heart disease, asthma and date of diagnosis
fr_string: tels que l’hypertension, diabète, asthme et date du diagnostique

en_string: This section is designed to help you describe your symptoms in English until a bilingual health professional can take over. The French translation is for the benefit of the health professional.
Describing the pain and its severity is a key factor in establishing diagnosis. Always try to rank it on a scale of one to 10, 10 being the worst pain you ever had.
What makes it better or worst
fr_string: Ce qui fait une difference positive ou négative

en_string: For interpreter services in cases of emergency, please contact MCDC during normal working hours at 418-332-3851 or 1-877-332-3851
